article:
Nathan Chen
================

Nathan Chen is an American figure skater who has been one of the most dominant forces in men's singles skating in recent years. He is a three-time World Champion, three-time Grand Prix Final Champion, and the 2022 Winter Olympic gold medalist. Chen's rise to the top of the figure skating world has been marked by his technical prowess, artistry, and consistency.

Early life and family
--------------------

Nathan Chen was born on May 5, 1999, in Salt Lake City, Utah. He is the youngest of five children to Chinese immigrant parents, Zhidong Chen and Mei Wang. Chen's parents encouraged his early interest in figure skating, and he began taking lessons at the age of three. He grew up in a close-knit family and credits his parents and siblings with supporting his skating career.

Competitive skating career
-------------------------

### Early career

Chen began competing in local and regional competitions as a juvenile skater. He quickly made a name for himself by winning several regional championships and qualifying for the U.S. Junior Championships. Chen's early success was marked by his technical ability and artistry on the ice.

### Junior career

Chen's junior career was highlighted by his victory at the 2014 U.S. Junior Championships. He went on to compete at the 2014 World Junior Championships, where he finished fourth. Chen's junior career laid the foundation for his future success in the senior ranks.

### Senior career

#### 2016–2017 season: Senior international debut, Four Continents title and first senior national title

Chen made his senior international debut at the 2016 U.S. International Classic, where he won the gold medal. He went on to win the 2016 Four Continents Championships, his first senior international title. Chen capped off the season by winning his first senior national title at the 2017 U.S. Championships.

#### 2017–2018 season: Pyeongchang Olympics and first World title

Chen's 2017-2018 season was marked by his Olympic debut at the Pyeongchang Winter Games. He finished fifth in the men's singles event but helped the U.S. team win the bronze medal in the team event. Chen went on to win his first World title at the 2018 World Championships.

#### 2018–2019 season: Second consecutive World title

Chen defended his World title at the 2019 World Championships, becoming the first American man to win back-to-back World titles since Todd Eldredge in 2001. He also won his second consecutive Grand Prix Final title.

#### 2019–2020 season: Third consecutive Grand Prix Final title

Chen's 2019-2020 season was highlighted by his third consecutive Grand Prix Final title. He also won the 2020 U.S. Championships, his fourth consecutive national title.

#### 2020–2021 season: Third consecutive World title

Chen's 2020-2021 season was marked by his third consecutive World title. He won the 2021 World Championships, becoming the first American man to win three consecutive World titles since Scott Hamilton in 1981.

#### 2021–2022 season: Olympic gold medal

Chen's 2021-2022 season was highlighted by his Olympic gold medal at the 2022 Beijing Winter Games. He became the first American man to win the Olympic gold medal in figure skating since Evan Lysacek in 2010.

#### 2022–23, 2023-24, and 2024–25 seasons: Hiatus

After the 2022 Winter Olympics, Chen announced that he would be taking a hiatus from competitive figure skating. He has not competed in any major competitions since the 2022 Olympics and has not announced any plans to return to competition.

Show-skating career
------------------

Chen has also had a successful show-skating career, performing in numerous ice shows and exhibitions. He has toured with Stars on Ice and has performed in several other shows, including the Ice Theatre of New York.

### Coaching

Chen has worked with several coaches throughout his career, including Rafael Arutyunyan, Marina Zoueva, and Oleg Vasiliev. He has credited his coaches with helping him develop his technical skills and artistic expression.

Skating technique and style
---------------------------

Chen is known for his technical ability and artistry on the ice. He has a strong foundation in the basics of figure skating and has developed a unique style that blends technical proficiency with artistic expression. Chen's skating is characterized by his powerful jumps, intricate footwork, and emotive performances.

Public life
------------

### Sponsorships, endorsements and partnerships

Chen has partnered with several brands, including Bridgestone, Nike, and Coca-Cola. He has also worked with several other companies, including Kellogg's and Samsung.

### Ambassadorships

Chen has served as an ambassador for several organizations, including the U.S. Olympic Committee and the National Figure Skating Foundation.

### Books and magazines

Chen has been featured in several books and magazines, including "Nathan Chen: My Story" and "The New York Times Magazine".

### Film and television

Chen has appeared in several films and television shows, including "The Ellen DeGeneres Show" and "Saturday Night Live".

### Philanthropic work and supported causes

Chen has supported several charitable causes, including the Boys and Girls Clubs of America and the U.S. Olympic Committee's Team USA Fund.

Awards and recognition
----------------------

Chen has received numerous awards and accolades throughout his career, including three World Championships titles, three Grand Prix Final titles, and an Olympic gold medal.

Personal life and education
---------------------------

Chen attended Yale University, where he studied computer science and statistics. He has credited his education with helping him develop his analytical skills and discipline.

Records and achievements
-----------------------

Chen has set several records throughout his career, including becoming the first American man to win three consecutive World titles since Scott Hamilton in 1981. He has also won the most Grand Prix Final titles by an American man, with three consecutive titles from 2017 to 2019.

Programs
---------

### Competition and exhibition programs

Chen's competition programs have included "Mao's Last Dancer" and "Land of All". He has also performed several exhibition programs, including "Nessun Dorma" and "Hallelujah".

### Programs after the 2022 Winter Olympics

After the 2022 Winter Olympics, Chen performed several exhibition programs, including "Rocket Man" and "Carry On".

article:
Founding Fathers of the United States

The Founding Fathers of the United States were a group of visionary individuals who played a crucial role in the formation and shaping of the United States. They were the leaders, thinkers, and politicians who drafted the Declaration of Independence, the United States Constitution, and the Bill of Rights. These documents, which have become the foundation of American democracy, were the result of a long process of debate, negotiation, and compromise among the Founding Fathers.

# Historical founders

The term "Founding Fathers" refers specifically to the group of individuals who signed the Declaration of Independence in 1776 and played a leading role in the American Revolution. However, the concept of a "founding" generation extends beyond this narrow definition. The historical founders of the United States include not only the signers of the Declaration of Independence but also other key figures who contributed to the growth and development of the American colonies.

# Origin of phrase

The term "Founding Fathers" was first used in the early 20th century to describe the group of individuals who played a leading role in the American Revolution. However, the concept of a "founding" generation has its roots in the 18th century, when American colonists began to speak of a "founding" generation of colonial leaders who had established the first settlements in North America.

# List of Founding Fathers

## Framers and signers

The following individuals were among the key framers and signers of the Declaration of Independence:

* George Washington
* John Adams
* Thomas Jefferson
* James Madison
* Benjamin Franklin
* Samuel Adams
* Patrick Henry
* John Hancock
* Roger Sherman
* Robert Livingston

### Other delegates

In addition to the signers of the Declaration of Independence, there were many other delegates who played important roles in the Continental Congress. Some notable examples include:

* George Mason
* James Monroe
* Alexander Hamilton
* Thomas Paine
* John Jay

## Additional Founding Fathers

The following individuals are often considered to be among the Founding Fathers, although they did not sign the Declaration of Independence:

* George Wythe
* Edmund Randolph
* James Wilson
* Oliver Ellsworth
* William Paterson

## Women founders

Although women did not play a direct role in the drafting of the Declaration of Independence or the Constitution, many women made important contributions to the American Revolution and the early years of the United States. Some notable examples include:

* Abigail Adams
* Deborah Read Franklin
* Esther Reed
* Mercy Otis Warren

## Other patriots

There were many other individuals who played important roles in the American Revolution and the early years of the United States. Some notable examples include:

* Crispus Attucks
* Paul Revere
* Joseph Warren
* John Paul Jones

# The colonies unite (1765–1774)

The American colonies began to unite in the mid-18th century, as they faced a series of common challenges and threats from Great Britain. The Stamp Act of 1765, which imposed a tax on printed materials, sparked widespread protests and boycotts throughout the colonies. The Boston Massacre of 1770 and the Boston Tea Party of 1773 further escalated tensions between the colonies and Great Britain.

# Continental Congress (1774–1775)

## First Continental Congress (1774)

In response to the Intolerable Acts, which were passed by the British Parliament in 1774, the First Continental Congress convened in Philadelphia in September of that year. The Congress, which was attended by representatives from 12 colonies, issued a statement of grievances and called for a boycott of British goods.

## Second Continental Congress (1775)

The Second Continental Congress convened in May 1775, following the outbreak of fighting at Lexington and Concord. The Congress, which was attended by representatives from all 13 colonies, established the Continental Army and appointed George Washington as its commander-in-chief.

# Declaration of Independence (1776)

The Declaration of Independence was adopted by the Continental Congress on July 4, 1776. The document, which was written by Thomas Jefferson, declared the 13 American colonies to be independent and sovereign states.

# Fighting for independence

The American Revolutionary War lasted from 1775 to 1783, as the Continental Army fought against the British Army and its allies. The war was marked by several key battles, including the Battle of Bunker Hill, the Battle of Saratoga, and the Battle of Yorktown.

## Treaty of Paris

The Treaty of Paris, which was signed in 1783, officially ended the American Revolutionary War and recognized American independence.

# Constitutional Convention

The Constitutional Convention, which was held in 1787, was a gathering of delegates from the 13 states who met to draft a new constitution for the United States. The Convention, which was attended by many of the same individuals who had played leading roles in the American Revolution, resulted in the creation of the United States Constitution.

## Virginia and New Jersey plans

The Virginia Plan and the New Jersey Plan were two competing proposals for a new constitution that were presented at the Constitutional Convention. The Virginia Plan, which was proposed by James Madison, called for a strong central government with three branches. The New Jersey Plan, which was proposed by William Paterson, called for a weaker central government with more power reserved for the states.

## Connecticut Compromise

The Connecticut Compromise, which was proposed by Roger Sherman and Oliver Ellsworth, called for a bicameral legislature with equal representation for each state in the Senate and representation based on population in the House of Representatives.

## State ratification conventions

The United States Constitution was ratified by the states in 1788, following a series of state ratification conventions. The ratification process was marked by intense debate and negotiation, as opponents of the Constitution argued that it gave too much power to the federal government.

## New form of government

The United States Constitution established a new form of government for the United States, with a strong central government and three branches. The Constitution also established the Bill of Rights, which guaranteed certain fundamental rights and freedoms to American citizens.

## Bill of Rights

The Bill of Rights, which was added to the Constitution in 1791, consisted of 10 amendments that guaranteed certain fundamental rights and freedoms to American citizens. The amendments included the right to free speech, the right to bear arms, and the right to a fair trial.

# Ascending to the presidency

George Washington, who was the commander-in-chief of the Continental Army during the American Revolution, was inaugurated as the first President of the United States in 1789. Washington's leadership and vision helped to establish the office of the presidency and set important precedents for future presidents.

# Demographics and other characteristics

## Political experience

Many of the Founding Fathers had extensive experience in politics and government before the American Revolution. For example, George Washington had served in the Virginia House of Burgesses, while John Adams had served in the Massachusetts General Court.

## Education

### American institutions

Many of the Founding Fathers were educated at American institutions, such as Harvard University and the College of William & Mary.

### British institutions

Some of the Founding Fathers, such as Benjamin Franklin and Thomas Jefferson, were educated at British institutions, such as the University of Edinburgh and the Inns of Court.

## Ethnicity

The Founding Fathers were primarily of English, Scottish, and Irish descent.

## Occupations

Many of the Founding Fathers were lawyers, farmers, or merchants.

# Religion

The Founding Fathers were primarily Christian, although some, such as Thomas Jefferson and Benjamin Franklin, were Deists.

# Founders on currency and postage

The Founding Fathers have been honored on American currency and postage, with their images appearing on coins, bills, and stamps.

# Political and cultural impact

## Political rhetoric

The Founding Fathers have had a lasting impact on American politics, with their ideas and ideals continuing to shape American political discourse.

## Holidays

The Founding Fathers are honored on several American holidays, including Independence Day and Presidents' Day.

## Media and theater

The Founding Fathers have been portrayed in numerous films, plays, and television shows, including the musical "1776" and the film "Lincoln."

## Sports

The Founding Fathers have been honored in the names of several American sports teams, including the Washington Redskins and the Philadelphia Liberty.

# Religious freedom

The Founding Fathers were strong advocates for religious freedom, with many of them arguing that the government should not impose any particular religion on its citizens.

# Slavery

The Founding Fathers were divided on the issue of slavery, with some, such as Thomas Jefferson and George Washington, owning slaves, while others, such as Benjamin Franklin and Alexander Hamilton, opposing slavery.

## Reconstruction as a "Second Founding"

Some historians have referred to the Reconstruction era, which followed the Civil War, as a "Second Founding," as it marked a significant turning point in American history and the expansion of American democracy.

# Scholarly analysis

## Early historians

Early historians, such as George Bancroft and David Ramsay, wrote extensively about the Founding Fathers and their role in American history.

## Modern historians

Modern historians, such as Gordon Wood and Joseph Ellis, have continued to study and write about the Founding Fathers, offering new insights and perspectives on their lives and ideas.

## Noted collections

article:
Tennis Professional Tours and Tournament Ranking Series

Tennis has a long history of professional tours and tournament ranking series, which have played a crucial role in shaping the sport into what it is today. These tours and series provide a framework for players to compete against each other, allowing them to test their skills, earn prize money, and gain recognition. In this article, we will delve into the world of professional tennis tours and tournament ranking series, exploring their history, structure, and notable winners.

# World Championship Tours

The World Championship tours are a series of elite tournaments that bring together the best tennis players from around the world. These tours are considered the pinnacle of professional tennis, offering the highest level of competition and prize money. The two main World Championship tours are the ATP Tour for men and the WTA Tour for women.

## Winners

The winners of the World Championship tours are considered among the greatest tennis players of all time. Some notable winners include:

* ATP Tour: Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal, and Roger Federer have dominated the tour in recent years, with each player holding multiple titles.
* WTA Tour: Serena Williams, Steffi Graf, and Martina Navratilova are some of the most successful players in WTA history, with numerous titles and accolades between them.

# Tournament Ranking Series

The Tournament Ranking Series is a system used to rank tennis players based on their performance in tournaments throughout the year. The series is divided into several tiers, with the top tier being the Grand Slam tournaments. The ranking system takes into account a player's performance in all tournaments, with more weight given to the higher-tier events.

## Winners

The winners of the Tournament Ranking Series are determined by their cumulative performance throughout the year. Some notable winners include:

* ATP Tour: The ATP World No. 1 is awarded to the player who finishes the year ranked No. 1 in the ATP rankings. Recent winners include Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal, and Andy Murray.
* WTA Tour: The WTA World No. 1 is awarded to the player who finishes the year ranked No. 1 in the WTA rankings. Recent winners include Simona Halep, Ashleigh Barty, and Naomi Osaka.

# Other Professional Tours

In addition to the World Championship tours and Tournament Ranking Series, there are several other professional tours that offer opportunities for players to compete and earn prize money.

## Women

* The ITF Women's Circuit is a series of tournaments that provide a platform for women players to compete and gain experience. The circuit is divided into several tiers, with the higher-tier events offering more prize money and ranking points.
* The WTA 125K Series is a series of tournaments that offer a higher level of competition and prize money than the ITF Women's Circuit.

## Men

* The ATP Challenger Tour is a series of tournaments that provide a platform for men players to compete and gain experience. The tour is divided into several tiers, with the higher-tier events offering more prize money and ranking points.
* The ITF Men's Circuit is a series of tournaments that offer a lower level of competition and prize money than the ATP Challenger Tour.

# See also

* List of tennis tournaments
* Tennis ranking system
* ATP Tour
* WTA Tour

# Notes

* This article provides a general overview of professional tennis tours and tournament ranking series. For more detailed information, please refer to the specific articles on each topic.

# References

* None

# Bibliography

* None

# External links

* ATP Tour official website
* WTA Tour official website
* ITF official website

article:
2023 UK Open

The 2023 UK Open was a professional darts tournament organized by the Professional Darts Corporation (PDC). The event took place from March 3 to 5, 2023, at the Butlin's Minehead Resort in Minehead, England. The tournament was the 21st edition of the UK Open and featured a total of 160 players competing for a share of the £500,000 prize fund.

# Prize money

The total prize fund for the 2023 UK Open was £500,000, with the winner receiving £100,000. The breakdown of the prize money is as follows:

* Winner: £100,000
* Runner-up: £50,000
* Semi-finalists: £26,000
* Quarter-finalists: £15,000
* Fifth round losers: £10,000
* Sixth round losers: £7,500
* Fourth round losers: £5,000
* Third round losers: £4,000
* Second round losers: £3,000
* First round losers: £2,000

# Format

The 2023 UK Open featured a unique format, with the tournament being played across three days. The event began with the first round, featuring the lowest-ranked players on the PDC Order of Merit, as well as the qualifiers from the PDC Development Tour, PDC Challenge Tour, and amateur events. The top 32 players on the PDC Order of Merit received byes into the fourth round, while the next 32 players received byes into the third round.

# Qualifiers

The 2023 UK Open featured a total of 160 players, with the majority of the field being made up of players from the PDC Order of Merit. The top 128 players on the PDC Order of Merit qualified for the event, with the remaining 32 places being filled by qualifiers from the PDC Development Tour, PDC Challenge Tour, and amateur events.

## Number 1–32 on the PDC Order of Merit (receiving byes into fourth round)

The top 32 players on the PDC Order of Merit received byes into the fourth round of the 2023 UK Open. These players included the likes of Gerwyn Price, Peter Wright, and Michael van Gerwen.

## Number 33–64 on the PDC Order of Merit (receiving byes into third round)

The next 32 players on the PDC Order of Merit received byes into the third round of the 2023 UK Open. These players included the likes of Dimitri Van den Bergh, Krzysztof Ratajski, and Jonny Clayton.

## Number 65–96 on the PDC Order of Merit (receiving byes into second round)

The next 32 players on the PDC Order of Merit received byes into the second round of the 2023 UK Open. These players included the likes of Ryan Searle, Luke Humphries, and Chris Dobey.

## Number 97–128 on the PDC Order of Merit (starting in first round)

The remaining 32 players on the PDC Order of Merit started the 2023 UK Open in the first round. These players included the likes of Mervyn King, Jamie Lewis, and Mickey Mansell.

## PDC Development Tour qualifiers (starting in first round)

Eight players from the PDC Development Tour qualified for the 2023 UK Open. These players included the likes of Ted Evetts, Luke Woodhouse, and Bradley Brooks.

## PDC Challenge Tour qualifiers (starting in first round)

2023 Scottish National Party leadership election

The 2023 Scottish National Party (SNP) leadership election was a contest to determine the next leader of the Scottish National Party, following the resignation of Nicola Sturgeon as the party's leader and First Minister of Scotland. The election was announced on February 15, 2023, and the results were declared on March 27, 2023.

# Background

Nicola Sturgeon had been the leader of the SNP and First Minister of Scotland since 2014, leading the party to successive election victories in the Scottish Parliament and the UK Parliament. However, on February 15, 2023, she announced her resignation as leader and First Minister, citing a desire to re-energize the party and the need for a new leader to take forward the party's agenda.

Following Sturgeon's resignation, a leadership contest was announced, with the party's national executive committee (NEC) setting out the rules and timeline for the election. The contest was open to all SNP members, with the winner to be determined by a one-member-one-vote (OMOV) system.

# Issues

The leadership election was dominated by several key issues, including economics, independence, and gender recognition reform.

## Economics

The SNP's economic policy has traditionally focused on promoting Scottish business and industry, as well as reducing inequality and poverty. However, the party has faced criticism for its handling of the economy, particularly in relation to the impact of COVID-19 and the cost-of-living crisis.

Candidates in the leadership election were asked to set out their visions for Scotland's economy, including how they would address the cost-of-living crisis, promote business and industry, and reduce inequality.

## Independence

The SNP's core policy is to achieve Scottish independence, and the leadership election was seen as an opportunity for the party to re-energize its independence campaign. Candidates were asked to set out their plans for achieving independence, including how they would negotiate with the UK government and engage with the Scottish public.

## Gender recognition reform

The SNP has been criticized for its handling of gender recognition reform, with some members of the party expressing concerns about the impact of the party's policies on women's rights. Candidates in the leadership election were asked to set out their views on gender recognition reform and how they would address the concerns of party members.

article:
Grant Wahl

Grant Wahl was an American sports journalist who was best known for his work as a soccer writer and television commentator. He was a prominent figure in the world of American soccer, and his writing and commentary were widely respected for their insight and analysis.

#Early life and education

Grant Wahl was born on December 29, 1973, in Mission, Kansas. He grew up in a family of modest means, and his parents encouraged his love of sports from an early age. Wahl was a talented athlete in his youth, playing soccer, basketball, and baseball in high school. However, it was soccer that truly captured his passion, and he went on to play the sport at Princeton University.

Wahl graduated from Princeton in 1996 with a degree in Politics. During his time at Princeton, he began to develop his writing skills, contributing to the university's student newspaper and writing for various other publications. After graduating, Wahl moved to New York City to pursue a career in journalism.

#Career

Wahl's career in journalism began in the late 1990s, when he landed a job as a writer for Sports Illustrated. He quickly established himself as a talented and knowledgeable writer, and his work was featured prominently in the magazine. In 2000, Wahl became the magazine's full-time soccer writer, a position he held for over a decade.

In addition to his work at Sports Illustrated, Wahl was also a regular commentator on television. He appeared on various networks, including ESPN, Fox Sports, and NBC Sports, providing analysis and commentary on soccer matches and events. Wahl was known for his insightful and engaging commentary style, which made him a popular figure among soccer fans.

Wahl was also a prolific writer, penning articles for a wide range of publications. He was a regular contributor to The New York Times, and his work was also featured in The Guardian, The Wall Street Journal, and other prominent newspapers and magazines.

In 2012, Wahl left Sports Illustrated to become a senior writer for Fox Sports. He worked for Fox until 2019, when he joined CBS Sports as a soccer analyst and writer. Wahl's work at CBS Sports was widely praised, and he became a key figure in the network's soccer coverage.

##Notable assignments

Wahl covered numerous high-profile soccer events throughout his career, including the World Cup, the European Championship, and the Olympics. He was also a regular presence at Major League Soccer (MLS) matches, and his writing and commentary helped to promote the growth of the sport in the United States.

One of Wahl's most notable assignments was his coverage of the 2018 World Cup in Russia. Wahl's reporting from the tournament was widely praised, and he provided insightful commentary on the matches and events.

#Personal life

Wahl was married to Céline Gounder, a physician and medical journalist. The couple met in 2001, and they were married in 2009. Wahl was known to be a private person, and he kept his personal life largely out of the public eye.

Wahl was also a dedicated philanthropist, and he supported various charitable causes throughout his career. He was particularly passionate about promoting education and healthcare initiatives, and he worked with numerous organizations to support these efforts.

##Hobbies and interests

Wahl was an avid music fan, and he enjoyed attending concerts and festivals. He was also a passionate traveler, and he loved exploring new cities and cultures. Wahl was a talented cook, and he enjoyed trying new recipes and experimenting with different cuisines.

#Death

Grant Wahl died on December 10, 2022, while covering the World Cup in Qatar. He was 49 years old at the time of his death. Wahl had been experiencing chest pains and other symptoms in the days leading up to his death, and he was treated by medical staff at the stadium. Despite their efforts, Wahl was pronounced dead at the scene.

Wahl's death was met with an outpouring of tributes and condolences from the soccer community and beyond. He was remembered as a talented and dedicated journalist, and his work and legacy were widely praised.

#Awards and recognition

Wahl received numerous awards and accolades throughout his career. He was a three-time winner of the National Sports Media Association's (NSMA) Sportswriter of the Year award, and he was also a recipient of the United States Soccer Federation's (USSF) Media Award.

In 2019, Wahl was inducted into the National Soccer Hall of Fame's Media Wing, a testament to his contributions to the sport.

#Books

Wahl wrote two books during his career. His first book, "The Beckham Experiment," was published in 2009 and chronicled the arrival of David Beckham in Major League Soccer. Wahl's second book, "Masters of Modern Soccer," was published in 2018 and explored the tactics and strategies of the world's top soccer teams.

##Other writing projects

Wahl was also a contributor to various other writing projects, including the "Best American Sports Writing" series. He was a regular guest on podcasts and radio shows, and his writing was featured in numerous anthologies and collections.

Royal Rumble (2023)

The Royal Rumble is a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) and livestreaming event produced by WWE. It took place on January 28, 2023, at the Alamodome in San Antonio, Texas. This marked the 36th event in the Royal Rumble chronology.

#Production

##Background

The Royal Rumble is an annual event that typically takes place in late January. It is one of the most popular and highly anticipated events in the WWE calendar, along with WrestleMania, SummerSlam, and Survivor Series. The event is known for its unique Royal Rumble match, where 30 wrestlers compete in a battle royal-style match, with the winner earning a world championship match at WrestleMania.

##Storylines

The event featured several storylines that built up to the matches. The main event saw Cody Rhodes competing in the Men's Royal Rumble match, looking to earn a shot at the Undisputed WWE Universal Championship. Rhodes had been on a roll, having defeated Seth Rollins and Finn Bálor in the weeks leading up to the event.

The Women's Royal Rumble match saw several female wrestlers looking to earn a shot at the Women's World Championship. Rhea Ripley was a favorite to win, having been on a dominant run in recent weeks. Other competitors included Liv Morgan, Raquel Rodriguez, and Shayna Baszler.

#Event

The event kicked off with a thrilling match between the teams of The Judgment Day (Damian Priest, Dominik Mysterio, and Finn Bálor) and the team of The Bloodline's Sami Zayn and Kevin Owens, with the match being won by the latter team.

##Preliminary matches

The first match saw Bray Wyatt defeating LA Knight in a Mountain Dew Pitch Black match, a match that was heavily promoted in the weeks leading up to the event. The match was a chaotic and intense affair, with both men using a variety of moves to try and gain the upper hand.

The next match saw Bianca Belair defending the Raw Women's Championship against Alexa Bliss. The match was a hard-hitting and competitive affair, with both women giving it their all. In the end, Belair emerged victorious, retaining her title.

##Main event

The main event saw Cody Rhodes winning the Men's Royal Rumble match, last eliminating Gunther to earn a shot at the Undisputed WWE Universal Championship at WrestleMania. The match was a thrilling and unpredictable affair, with several surprises and eliminations throughout.

The Women's Royal Rumble match saw Rhea Ripley winning, last eliminating Liv Morgan to earn a shot at the Women's World Championship at WrestleMania. The match was a hard-hitting and intense affair, with several competitors giving it their all.

#Reception

The event received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the thrilling matches and surprises throughout. The Men's and Women's Royal Rumble matches were particularly praised, with many considering them two of the best in recent years.

#Aftermath

##Raw

article:
2023 Malaysia Super League

The 2023 Malaysia Super League, also known as the CIMB Malaysia Super League for sponsorship reasons, is the 22nd season of the Malaysia Super League, the top-tier professional football league in Malaysia. The season began on February 24, 2023, and is scheduled to conclude on November 27, 2023.

# Teams

The 2023 Malaysia Super League features 14 teams, including the 12 teams from the 2022 season and two promoted teams from the 2022 Malaysia Premier League.

## Changes from last season

### Team changes

* Kuala Lumpur City and Sri Pahang were relegated to the 2023 Malaysia Premier League after finishing 13th and 14th in the 2022 Malaysia Super League, respectively.
* Kuching City and Kelantan were promoted to the 2023 Malaysia Super League after winning the 2022 Malaysia Premier League and finishing as runners-up, respectively.
* Sabah FC changed their name to Sabah FC Kota Kinabalu.

## Clubs locations

article:
Super Bowl LVI was the 56th edition of the Super Bowl, the annual championship game of the National Football League (NFL). The game took place on February 13, 2022, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, marking the first time the stadium hosted the Super Bowl.

#Background

The 2021-2022 NFL season was played amidst the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, which had a significant impact on the league's operations and the Super Bowl.

##Host selection process

The NFL announced on May 24, 2017, that SoFi Stadium would host Super Bowl LVI. The stadium, which opened in 2020, is the home of the Los Angeles Rams and the Los Angeles Chargers. The NFL selected SoFi Stadium as the host site over Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Florida, which had bid on the game.

##Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the 2021-2022 NFL season, with multiple games postponed or rescheduled due to outbreaks among teams. The Super Bowl was also affected, with the NFL implementing various protocols to minimize the risk of transmission, including limiting attendance to vaccinated individuals and requiring masks to be worn at all times.

#Teams

##Los Angeles Rams

The Los Angeles Rams entered Super Bowl LVI as the fourth seed in the NFC playoffs. The team finished the regular season with a 12-5 record, winning the NFC West division title. The Rams were led by quarterback Matthew Stafford, who threw for 4,886 yards and 41 touchdowns during the regular season.

##Cincinnati Bengals

The Cincinnati Bengals entered Super Bowl LVI as the fourth seed in the AFC playoffs. The team finished the regular season with a 10-7 record, winning the AFC North division title. The Bengals were led by quarterback Joe Burrow, who threw for 4,611 yards and 30 touchdowns during the regular season.

##Playoffs

Both teams had to win three games in the playoffs to reach the Super Bowl. The Rams defeated the Arizona Cardinals, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, and the San Francisco 49ers, while the Bengals defeated the Las Vegas Raiders, the Tennessee Titans, and the Kansas City Chiefs.

##Pre-game notes

Super Bowl LVI marked the first time that two teams with identical seedings (fourth) met in the championship game. The Rams were seeking their second Super Bowl title in franchise history, while the Bengals were seeking their first.

#Entertainment

##Pre-game ceremonies

The pre-game ceremonies featured a performance by Mickey Guyton, who sang the national anthem. The coin toss was performed by Billie Jean King, a tennis legend and social activist.

##Halftime show

The halftime show featured a performance by Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Mary J. Blige, and Kendrick Lamar. The show was widely praised for its high energy and nostalgic value.

#Broadcasting

##United States

###Television

The game was broadcast nationally on NBC, with Al Michaels and Cris Collinsworth serving as the play-by-play announcers. The broadcast was also available in Spanish on Telemundo.

####Advertising

Super Bowl LVI featured a number of high-profile commercials, including ads from major brands such as Pepsi, Coca-Cola, and Amazon.

###Streaming

The game was also available to stream on various platforms, including the NBC Sports app and Peacock.

###Radio

The game was broadcast nationally on Westwood One, with Kevin Harlan and Kurt Warner serving as the play-by-play announcers.

###Ratings and viewership

Super Bowl LVI was watched by an average of 112.3 million viewers on NBC, making it one of the most-watched television events in U.S. history.

##International

The game was broadcast in over 200 countries and territories around the world, with various networks and platforms providing coverage.

#Game summary

##First half

The Rams took an early lead on a 79-yard touchdown pass from Matthew Stafford to Odell Beckham Jr. The Bengals responded with a field goal, but the Rams scored again on a 1-yard touchdown run by Cooper Kupp. The Bengals scored a touchdown late in the half, but the Rams led 13-6 at halftime.

##Second half

The Rams extended their lead on a 75-yard touchdown pass from Matthew Stafford to Cooper Kupp. The Bengals responded with a touchdown, but the Rams scored again on a 79-yard touchdown pass from Matthew Stafford to Odell Beckham Jr. The Bengals scored a late touchdown, but the Rams held on for a 23-20 victory.

##Box score

* Los Angeles Rams: 23
* Cincinnati Bengals: 20

#Final statistics

##Statistical comparison

* Total offense: Rams (369), Bengals (305)
* Passing yards: Rams (283), Bengals (237)
* Rushing yards: Rams (86), Bengals (68)
* Turnovers: Rams (0), Bengals (1)

##Individual statistics

* Matthew Stafford (Rams): 26/40, 283 yards, 2 TDs
* Joe Burrow (Bengals): 26/41, 237 yards, 1 TD
* Cooper Kupp (Rams): 8 receptions, 92 yards, 2 TDs
* Ja'Marr Chase (Bengals): 5 receptions, 89 yards

#Starting lineups

* Los Angeles Rams:
	+ Offense: Matthew Stafford (QB), Cam Akers (RB), Cooper Kupp (WR), Odell Beckham Jr. (WR), Tyler Higbee (TE), Andrew Whitworth (LT), Austin Corbett (LG), Brian Allen (C), Austin Blythe (RG), Rob Havenstein (RT)
	+ Defense: Aaron Donald (DT), Greg Gaines (DT), Von Miller (LB), Leonard Floyd (LB), Ernest Jones (LB), Jalen Ramsey (CB), Darious Williams (CB), Taylor Rapp (S), Nick Scott (S)
* Cincinnati Bengals:
	+ Offense: Joe Burrow (QB), Joe Mixon (RB), Ja'Marr Chase (WR), Tee Higgins (WR), C.J. Uzomah (TE), Jonah Williams (LT), Quinton Spain (LG), Trey Hopkins (C), Jackson Carman (RG), Riley Reiff (RT)
	+ Defense: B.J. Hill (DT), Larry Ogunjobi (DT), Trey Hendrickson (DE), Sam Hubbard (DE), Logan Wilson (LB), Germaine Pratt (LB), Eli Apple (CB), Chidobe Awuzie (CB), Jessie Bates (S), Vonn Bell (S)

#Aftermath

The Los Angeles Rams celebrated their second Super Bowl title in franchise history, while the Cincinnati Bengals fell short of their first championship.

#Notes

* Super Bowl LVI was the first Super Bowl to be played on the second Sunday in February.
* The game marked the first time that two teams with identical seedings (fourth) met in the championship game.
* The Rams' victory marked the first time that a team had won the Super Bowl in their home stadium.

Faithful and District Football Association

The Faithful and District Football Association is a regional Australian Rules football league based in the Faithful Creek region of Victoria, Australia. The league was established in 1909 and has since become a prominent sporting organization in the area, featuring several local football clubs and hosting various competitions and events throughout the year.

#History

The Faithful and District Football Association was formed in 1909, with the first meeting of the league taking place on April 10th of that year. The league was established with the aim of promoting and developing Australian Rules football in the Faithful Creek region, and its early years saw rapid growth and expansion. The league's first season commenced in May 1909, with four teams competing in the inaugural competition.

In the early years of the league, teams were primarily made up of local farmers, laborers, and shopkeepers, who would gather on weekends to compete against neighboring towns and villages. As the league grew in popularity, more teams joined, and the competition became more formalized. The league's first grand final was played in 1910, with the Faithful Creek Football Club emerging as the first premiers.

Over the years, the Faithful and District Football Association has undergone several changes and expansions. In the 1920s, the league introduced a reserves competition, allowing younger players to develop their skills and gain experience. The 1950s saw the introduction of a junior competition, which has since become a vital part of the league's development programs.

In recent years, the league has continued to grow and evolve, with the introduction of new teams and the development of improved facilities and infrastructure. Today, the Faithful and District Football Association is one of the largest and most respected regional football leagues in Victoria.

##Notable Events and Milestones

* 1909: The Faithful and District Football Association is formed, with the first meeting taking place on April 10th.
* 1910: The league's first grand final is played, with Faithful Creek emerging as the first premiers.
* 1920s: The league introduces a reserves competition, allowing younger players to develop their skills.
* 1950s: The league introduces a junior competition, which becomes a vital part of the league's development programs.
* 2009: The league celebrates its centenary, marking 100 years since its formation.

* Oakdale Football Club: Established in 1912, Oakdale has a strong rivalry with neighboring towns and has won several premierships over the years.
* Willow Creek Football Club: Founded in 1920, Willow Creek has a loyal following and has produced several talented players over the years.
* Maple Ridge Football Club: Established in 1950, Maple Ridge has become a consistent performer in the league, winning several premierships.
* Green Valley Football Club: Founded in 1960, Green Valley has a strong focus on junior development and has produced several talented young players.
* Riverview Football Club: Established in 1970, Riverview has a strong rivalry with neighboring towns and has won several premierships.
* Hilltop Football Club: Founded in 1980, Hilltop has become a consistent performer in the league, winning several premierships.
* Lakeside Football Club: Established in 1990, Lakeside has a strong focus on junior development and has produced several talented young players.

##Club Histories

Each of the eight clubs in the Faithful and District Football Association has its own unique history and traditions. From the early days of the league to the present, each club has played a significant role in shaping the competition.

##Recent Grand Finals

* 2011: Willow Creek defeated Maple Ridge by 10 points in the grand final.
* 2012: Green Valley defeated Riverview by 15 points in the grand final.
* 2013: Hilltop defeated Lakeside by 20 points in the grand final.
* 2014: Faithful Creek defeated Oakdale by 30 points in the grand final.

#O'Loan Cup

The O'Loan Cup is an annual competition run by the Faithful and District Football Association, featuring the top teams from the league. The competition is named after long-time league administrator, Jack O'Loan, who served as secretary of the league for over 20 years.

article:
Lists of feature films with LGBT characters

Feature films that include LGBT characters have been produced for decades, with some of the earliest examples dating back to the 1920s. These films have played an important role in shaping public perceptions and attitudes towards LGBT individuals and communities. This article provides a comprehensive overview of lists of feature films with LGBT characters, including films that have been recognized for their portrayal of LGBT themes and characters.

#Early films (1920s-1960s)

The earliest films to include LGBT characters were often produced in Europe, particularly in Germany and France, where there was a more relaxed attitude towards depictions of same-sex relationships on screen. Some notable examples from this period include:

##Pandora's Box (1929)
Pandora's Box is a German silent film directed by Georg Wilhelm Pabst. The film tells the story of a young woman named Lulu who becomes embroiled in a series of scandalous relationships, including one with a lesbian countess.

##Girls in Uniform (1931)
Girls in Uniform is a German film directed by Leontine Sagan. The film is set in a boarding school and follows the story of a young girl who falls in love with her teacher.

##Olivia (1951)
Olivia is a French film directed by Jacqueline Audry. The film is set in a boarding school and follows the story of a young girl who falls in love with her teacher.

#New Wave and counterculture (1960s-1970s)

The 1960s and 1970s saw the emergence of new wave and counterculture movements in film, which led to a greater willingness to explore LGBT themes and characters on screen. Some notable examples from this period include:

##The Killing of Sister George (1968)
The Killing of Sister George is a British film directed by Robert Aldrich. The film tells the story of a middle-aged lesbian actress who becomes embroiled in a scandalous affair with a younger woman.

##Midnight Cowboy (1969)
Midnight Cowboy is an American film directed by John Schlesinger. The film tells the story of a young man who travels to New York City and becomes embroiled in a series of relationships, including one with a gay man.

##Sunday Bloody Sunday (1971)
Sunday Bloody Sunday is a British film directed by John Schlesinger. The film tells the story of a love triangle between two men and a woman.

#Mainstream recognition (1980s-1990s)

The 1980s and 1990s saw a growing recognition of LGBT films and characters in mainstream cinema. Some notable examples from this period include:

##Desert Hearts (1985)
Desert Hearts is an American film directed by Donna Deitch. The film tells the story of a romance between two women in 1950s Nevada.

##My Beautiful Laundrette (1985)
My Beautiful Laundrette is a British film directed by Stephen Frears. The film tells the story of a romance between two men from different cultural backgrounds.

##Philadelphia (1993)
Philadelphia is an American film directed by Jonathan Demme. The film tells the story of a man with AIDS who is fired from his job because of his condition.

#Contemporary films (2000s-present)

In recent years, there has been a growing number of films that feature LGBT characters and explore LGBT themes. Some notable examples include:

##Brokeback Mountain (2005)
Brokeback Mountain is an American film directed by Ang Lee. The film tells the story of a romance between two men in rural Wyoming.

##Milk (2008)
Milk is an American film directed by Gus Van Sant. The film tells the story of the life of gay rights activist Harvey Milk.

##Moonlight (2016)
Moonlight is an American film directed by Barry Jenkins. The film tells the story of a young black man growing up in Miami and struggling with his sexuality.

#Awards and recognition

LGBT films and characters have been recognized with numerous awards and accolades over the years. Some notable examples include:

##Academy Awards
The Academy Awards have recognized several LGBT films and characters over the years, including "Philadelphia," "Milk," and "Moonlight."

##GLAAD Media Awards
The GLAAD Media Awards are presented annually to recognize and honor outstanding LGBT representation in media. Some notable winners include "Brokeback Mountain," "Milk," and "Moonlight."

#Impact and influence

LGBT films and characters have had a significant impact on popular culture and society. They have helped to shape public perceptions and attitudes towards LGBT individuals and communities, and have provided a platform for LGBT voices and stories to be heard.

##Social impact
LGBT films and characters have had a significant social impact, helping to raise awareness and promote understanding of LGBT issues. They have also provided a platform for LGBT individuals and communities to share their stories and experiences.

##Cultural impact
LGBT films and characters have had a significant cultural impact, influencing the way that LGBT individuals and communities are represented in media and popular culture. They have also helped to shape the way that LGBT individuals and communities are perceived and understood by the wider public.

article:
Elvis (2022 film)

Elvis is a 2022 biographical drama film directed by Baz Luhrmann, who co-wrote the screenplay with Sam Bromell, Craig Pearce, and Jeremy Doner. The film is based on the life of American musician Elvis Presley, with Austin Butler starring in the title role. The movie explores Presley's rise to fame, his relationship with his manager Colonel Tom Parker, and his struggles with fame and personal identity.

#Plot

The film opens with a framing device featuring an elderly Colonel Tom Parker, played by Tom Hanks, who reminisces about his time managing Elvis Presley. The story then flashes back to Presley's childhood, where he grows up in a poor household with his parents, Vernon and Gladys. The young Elvis is exposed to various musical genres, including gospel, blues, and country, which shape his unique sound.

As Presley becomes a teenager, he begins performing in local talent shows and eventually records a demo at Sun Records. Parker, who is working as a carnival barker at the time, discovers Presley and becomes his manager. With Parker's guidance, Presley's popularity grows rapidly, and he lands a recording contract with RCA Records.

The film follows Presley's rise to fame, including his early days performing on the Louisiana Hayride and his appearances on the Ed Sullivan Show. As Presley's popularity grows, so does his relationship with Parker, who becomes increasingly controlling and manipulative. The film also explores Presley's romance with Priscilla Ann Beaulieu, played by Olivia DeJonge, and his struggles with addiction and personal identity.

#Cast

* Austin Butler as Elvis Presley
* Tom Hanks as Colonel Tom Parker
* Olivia DeJonge as Priscilla Ann Beaulieu
* Maggie Gyllenhaal as Gladys Presley
* Rufus Sewell as Vernon Presley
* Yola as Sister Rosetta Tharpe
* Alton Mason as Little Richard
* Gary Clark Jr. as Arthur "Big Boy" Crudup
* Shonka Dukureh as Willie Mae "Big Mama" Thornton

#Production

##Development and casting

The project was first announced in 2014, with Baz Luhrmann set to direct and write the screenplay. Luhrmann spent several years researching Presley's life and working on the script, which was influenced by Presley's music and personal experiences.

Austin Butler was cast as Presley in 2019, following an extensive audition process. Butler spent several months preparing for the role, including learning to sing and dance like Presley. Tom Hanks was cast as Colonel Parker, and the rest of the cast was assembled over the next several months.

##Filming

Principal photography began in January 2020 and took place in Australia and the United States. The film's production was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic, but filming resumed in September 2020.

The film's cinematography was handled by Mandy Walker, who worked closely with Luhrmann to capture the vibrant colors and energy of Presley's music. The film's production design was led by Catherine Martin, who recreated the iconic settings of Presley's life, including his childhood home and the Jungle Room.

##Music

The film features a mix of Presley's original recordings and new versions performed by Butler. The soundtrack includes several of Presley's most famous songs, including "Hound Dog," "Jailhouse Rock," and "Suspicious Minds."

Butler spent several months rehearsing with a vocal coach to learn Presley's distinctive singing style. The film's music supervisor, Anton Monsted, worked closely with Luhrmann and Butler to select the songs that would be featured in the film.

#Marketing

The film's marketing campaign was launched in February 2022, with the release of the first trailer. The trailer featured Butler as Presley, performing a energetic rendition of "Hound Dog."

The film's promotional campaign included several television spots and print ads, which highlighted the film's music and Butler's performance. The film's social media campaign included a series of videos and posts featuring the cast and crew.

#Release

##2022 original release

The film was released on June 24, 2022, in the United States and Canada. The film premiered at the Cannes Film Festival in May 2022, where it received a standing ovation.

The film opened at number two at the box office, grossing $31.2 million in its opening weekend. The film received positive reviews from critics, with many praising Butler's performance.

##2023 re-release

The film was re-released in January 2023, following Butler's Golden Globe win for Best Actor. The re-release included a new trailer and promotional campaign, which highlighted the film's awards buzz.

##Plan for a four-hour cut release

In August 2022, Luhrmann announced plans to release a four-hour cut of the film, which would include additional scenes and performances. The extended cut is expected to be released on Blu-ray and streaming platforms in 2023.

#Reception

##Box office

The film grossed $287.3 million worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of 2022. The film performed well in the United States, grossing $151.1 million, and also performed well internationally, grossing $136.2 million.

##Audience viewership

The film received positive reviews from audiences, with many praising Butler's performance and the film's music. The film received an A- CinemaScore from audiences surveyed by CinemaScore.

##Critical response

The film received positive reviews from critics, with many praising Butler's performance and the film's music. The film holds a 78% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 422 reviews.

Several critics praised Butler's performance, with many noting that he captured Presley's energy and charisma. The film's music and production design were also widely praised.

##Response of the Presley family

The Presley family, including Priscilla Presley and Lisa Marie Presley, attended the film's premiere and praised Butler's performance. Priscilla Presley noted that Butler had "captured the essence" of her ex-husband, while Lisa Marie Presley praised the film's music and production design.

##Accolades

The film received several awards and nominations, including an Academy Award nomination for Best Actor for Butler. The film also won several Golden Globe Awards, including Best Actor for Butler and Best Supporting Actor for Hanks.

#Historical accuracy

The film has been praised for its historical accuracy, with many noting that it captures the spirit of Presley's life and music. However, some critics have noted that the film takes creative liberties with Presley's story, including his relationship with Parker and his struggles with addiction.

#See also

#Notes

* The film's title, "Elvis," is a reference to Presley's iconic nickname, "The King of Rock and Roll."
* The film's cinematography was influenced by the work of Stanley Kubrick and Martin Scorsese.
* The film's production design was influenced by the work of Catherine Martin, who has worked on several of Luhrmann's previous films.

Canada national ringette team

The Canada national ringette team represents Canada in the sport of ringette. The team is governed by Ringette Canada, the national governing body for the sport in Canada. Ringette is a fast-paced team sport that originated in Canada in the 1960s, and the country has been a dominant force in the sport ever since.

# Early history

Ringette was invented in 1963 in Ontario, Canada, by Sam Jacks, a recreation director for the city of North Bay. The game was initially designed for girls as a alternative to hockey, but it quickly gained popularity across Canada and eventually spread to other countries. The first Canadian national ringette championships were held in 1974, and the country has since become a hotbed for the sport.

# World Championship record

Canada has a long and successful history at the Ringette World Championships, which were first held in 1990. The country has won a total of six gold medals, five silver medals, and one bronze medal at the tournament.

## Summit Series

The Summit Series is a biennial tournament that pits the best ringette players from Canada against their counterparts from Finland, which has emerged as a major rival in the sport. The series was first held in 2004, and Canada has won four of the six tournaments held to date.

## Senior Canada

The Senior Canada team represents the country at the Ringette World Championships and the Summit Series. The team is made up of the best ringette players from across Canada, and is governed by Ringette Canada.

## Junior Canada

The Junior Canada team represents the country at the Ringette World Junior Championships and other international tournaments. The team is made up of players aged 18 and under, and is also governed by Ringette Canada.

# Team Canada Senior

The Team Canada Senior team is the top-level national ringette team in Canada. The team is made up of the best players from across the country, and competes at the Ringette World Championships and the Summit Series.

# Team Canada Junior

The Team Canada Junior team is the national junior ringette team in Canada. The team competes at the Ringette World Junior Championships and other international tournaments, and is made up of players aged 18 and under.

# Medal record

article:
Etharkkum Thunindhavan

Etharkkum Thunindhavan is a 2022 Indian Tamil-language action thriller film written and directed by Pandiraj. The film stars Suriya, Priyanka Arul Mohan, and Sathyaraj in lead roles, with Vinay Rai, Saranya Ponvannan, and Soori in supporting roles.

# Plot

The film revolves around the story of a lawyer named Kannabiran, played by Suriya, who decides to take revenge against the people who destroyed his sister's life after she was raped. Kannabiran, along with his friends, sets out to punish the perpetrators, while also dealing with the corruption and flaws in the Indian legal system.

As the story unfolds, Kannabiran's quest for justice becomes a mission to bring about change in the society. The film explores themes of violence, revenge, and justice, raising questions about the morality and effectiveness of taking the law into one's own hands.

# Cast

* Suriya as Kannabiran
* Priyanka Arul Mohan as Inba
* Sathyaraj as Inba's father
* Vinay Rai as a police officer
* Saranya Ponvannan as Kannabiran's mother
* Soori as Kannabiran's friend
* M. S. Bhaskar as Kannabiran's friend
* Devadarshini as Kannabiran's sister
* S. J. Surya as a lawyer

# Production

## Development

The film was officially announced in January 2020, with Pandiraj set to direct and Suriya starring in the lead role. The film's script was written by Pandiraj, who had previously collaborated with Suriya on the film "Pasanga."

## Pre-production

article:
Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny is an upcoming American action-adventure film directed by James Mangold and written by Mangold, Jez Butterworth, and John-Henry Butterworth. It is the fifth installment in the Indiana Jones film series and a sequel to Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull (2008). The film stars Harrison Ford reprising his iconic role as Indiana Jones, alongside Phoebe Waller-Bridge, Mads Mikkelsen, Thomas Kretschmann, Boyd Holbrook, Shaunette Renée Wilson, and Toby Jones.

# Plot

The plot of Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny takes place in 1969, during the Space Age. Indiana Jones is an older man now, and the world is changing rapidly around him. The film follows Indy as he becomes embroiled in a new adventure, racing against time to prevent a powerful artifact from falling into the wrong hands. The story explores themes of nostalgia, identity, and the consequences of playing with forces beyond human control.

# Cast

The cast of Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny includes:

* Harrison Ford as Indiana Jones
* Phoebe Waller-Bridge as Helena Shaw
* Mads Mikkelsen as Jürgen Voller
* Thomas Kretschmann as Colonel Weber
* Boyd Holbrook as Klaber
* Shaunette Renée Wilson as Mason
* Toby Jones as Basil Shaw

# Production

## Development

The development of Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny began in 2016, when Walt Disney Pictures and Lucasfilm announced plans to produce a fifth Indiana Jones film. At the time, Steven Spielberg was set to direct, with a script by David Koepp. However, in 2018, Spielberg dropped out of the project, and James Mangold was brought on board to direct.

## Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in 2020, with Mangold working on the script alongside Jez Butterworth and John-Henry Butterworth. The story underwent significant changes during this period, with the filmmakers aiming to create a more personal and character-driven narrative.

## Casting

Casting for the film took place in 2020 and 2021, with Harrison Ford set to reprise his iconic role as Indiana Jones. Phoebe Waller-Bridge was cast as Helena Shaw, a new character and Indy's goddaughter. Mads Mikkelsen was cast as Jürgen Voller, a former Nazi and the main antagonist of the film.

## Filming

Principal photography on Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny began in June 2021, in the United Kingdom. The shoot was initially set to last for 16 weeks, but it was extended due to the complexities of the action sequences and the need for additional photography. Filming took place in various locations, including the UK, Morocco, and Italy.

## Visual effects

The visual effects for Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny were created by Industrial Light & Magic. The film's VFX supervisor, Michael Gioulakis, worked closely with James Mangold to develop the visual style and tone of the film.

### De-aging

One of the most significant visual effects challenges in the film was the de-aging of Harrison Ford. The filmmakers used advanced digital technology to create a younger version of Indy, which appears in several scenes throughout the film. The process involved creating a detailed digital model of Ford's face and body, which was then animated and integrated into the live-action footage.

## Music

The score for Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny was composed by John Williams, who has worked on all five Indiana Jones films. The music is a mix of action-adventure themes, nostalgic cues, and new material that reflects the changing tone and style of the film. The score was recorded by the London Symphony Orchestra in 2022.

# Themes and influences

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny explores several themes, including nostalgia, identity, and the consequences of playing with forces beyond human control. The film is influenced by the Indiana Jones franchise as a whole, as well as by other action-adventure films and pulp fiction. James Mangold has cited films like The Wild Bunch and The Good, the Bad and the Ugly as influences on the film's tone and style.

# Release

## Marketing

The marketing campaign for Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny began in 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer and several promotional images. The campaign has focused on the nostalgia and excitement of the Indiana Jones franchise, while also highlighting the new characters and storylines in the film.

## Theatrical

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny is set to be released in theaters on June 30, 2023. The film will be distributed by Walt Disney Pictures and Lucasfilm, and it will be released in IMAX and other premium formats.

## Home media

The home media release of Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny is expected to take place in late 2023 or early 2024. The film will be available on digital platforms, DVD, and Blu-ray, with several special features and behind-the-scenes content.

# Reception

## Box office

The box office performance of Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny is expected to be strong, given the popularity of the franchise and the excitement surrounding the film's release. The film's budget is estimated to be around $250 million, and it is expected to gross several hundred million dollars worldwide.

## Critical response

The critical response to Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny has been generally positive, with many praising the film's action sequences, visual effects, and performances. However, some critics have noted that the film's story and characters are not as well-developed as those in previous Indiana Jones films.

## Accolades

Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny has been recognized with several awards and nominations, including a Critics' Choice Movie Award nomination for Best Action Movie.

The future of the Indiana Jones franchise is uncertain, but it is likely that the series will continue in some form. Harrison Ford has stated that he will not reprise his role as Indiana Jones again, but the character could potentially be recast or passed on to a new actor.

2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup

The 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup is the 41st edition of the AFC U-20 Asian Cup, the biennial international youth football championship organized by the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) for the men's under-20 national teams of Asia. The tournament is currently being held from 1 to 18 March 2023 in Uzbekistan.

#Qualification

The qualification process for the 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup began in September 2022. A total of 44 teams entered the qualifying phase, competing for 16 spots in the final tournament. The teams were divided into 11 groups, with the group winners and four best runners-up advancing to the final tournament.

##Qualified teams

The following 16 teams qualified for the 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup:

*  Australia

*  Uzbekistan (hosts)

#Venues

The 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup is being held in three cities in Uzbekistan: Tashkent, Fergana, and Karshi. A total of four stadiums are being used for the tournament:

*  Bunyodkor Stadium, Tashkent
*  JAR Stadium, Tashkent
*  Fergana Stadium, Fergana
*  Shohruh Stadium, Karshi

#Trophy

The trophy for the 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup is awarded to the winning team. The trophy is made of silver and gold, and is 45 cm high and 22 cm wide.

#Match officials

A total of 20 referees and 20 assistant referees were appointed for the 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup.

#Draw

The draw for the 2023 AFC U-20 Asian Cup was held on 26 October 2022 in Tashkent, Uzbekistan. The 16 teams were divided into four groups of four teams each, with the teams being seeded based on their performance in the 2018 AFC U-19 Championship and the 2020 AFC U-19 Championship.

#Squads

#Group stage

article:
Cornel Țăranu

Cornel Țăranu is a Romanian composer, musicologist, and writer, known for his significant contributions to the development of Romanian music and his eclectic style, which blends elements of neoclassicism, postmodernism, and historicism.

# Biography

## Early life and neoclassical debut

Cornel Țăranu was born on June 20, 1934, in Cluj-Napoca, Romania. He began his musical studies at the Gheorghe Dima Music Academy in Cluj-Napoca, where he earned a degree in composition and musicology. During his early years, Țăranu was heavily influenced by the neoclassical movement, which was popular at the time. His early works, such as his String Quartet No. 1 (1956) and his Symphony No. 1 (1958), showcase his mastery of neoclassical techniques and his ability to craft elegant, balanced compositions.

## Paris studies and Ars Nova

In the early 1960s, Țăranu traveled to Paris, where he studied at the École Normale de Musique. During his time in Paris, he was exposed to the avant-garde movement and the works of composers such as Pierre Boulez and Karlheinz Stockhausen. This exposure had a profound impact on Țăranu's compositional style, and he began to incorporate elements of serialism and aleatory music into his works. His involvement with the Ars Nova movement, a group of Romanian composers who sought to create a new, experimental music, further solidified his position as a leading figure in Romanian musical modernism.

## Postmodernism and historicism

In the 1970s and 1980s, Țăranu's compositional style underwent a significant shift, as he began to explore elements of postmodernism and historicism. His works from this period, such as his Symphony No. 4 (1975) and his opera, "Derby" (1980), showcase his ability to blend disparate elements and create complex, layered compositions. Țăranu's use of quotation and allusion, as well as his incorporation of folk and popular music elements, further demonstrate his postmodern inclinations.

## Old age

In his later years, Țăranu has continued to compose, albeit at a slower pace. His recent works, such as his String Quartet No. 6 (2003) and his Symphony No. 7 (2008), demonstrate a continued interest in exploring new sounds and techniques. Despite his advanced age, Țăranu remains a vital figure in Romanian musical life, and his contributions to the development of Romanian music continue to be celebrated and recognized.

# Selected works

* String Quartet No. 1 (1956)
* Symphony No. 1 (1958)
* Symphony No. 4 (1975)
* Opera, "Derby" (1980)
* String Quartet No. 6 (2003)
* Symphony No. 7 (2008)
